discussion.content: PMBOK 6th Ed. 11.3. The answer is A - Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis - the process of prioritizing project risks for further analysis or action by assessing their probability of occurrence and impact as well as other characteristics.

A. Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis

The process in Project Risk Management that prioritizes project risks is "Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis." In this process, project risks are assessed and prioritized based on their impact and probability. Qualitative risk analysis assigns a risk rating to each identified risk, allowing project managers to focus their attention on the most significant and potentially impactful risks. This prioritization helps in determining which risks require further analysis (quantitative risk analysis) and which risks require the development of risk response plans (plan risk responses).

Selected Answer: A
Definitely Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis.

questions.question_text: What process in Project Risk Management prioritizes project risks?
What process is performed periodically throughout the project as needed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Plan Communications Management

This process involves determining the information and communication needs of the project stakeholders and defining the communication approach.

 As the project evolves, stakeholder needs and communication requirements can change, necessitating periodic updates to the communication plan.   

The other options are typically performed once at the beginning of the project or at specific intervals, rather than continuously throughout the project life cycle.

B. Plan Communications Management

The process of "Plan Communications Management" is performed periodically throughout the project as needed. It involves developing and maintaining a communications management plan that guides how project communication activities will be conducted. Since communication needs and strategies can change as the project progresses, this process may be revisited and updated periodically to ensure that communication remains effective and aligned with project requirements and stakeholder needs.

Selected Answer: A
The process that is performed periodically throughout the project as needed is "A. Plan Risk Management." This process involves identifying, assessing, and planning for potential risks throughout the project's lifecycle and is not a one-time activity but rather an ongoing and iterative process to address new risks as they arise.

Selected Answer: B

reference PMBOK pg 336

B. Lessons learned

When a project team is closing out a phase and updating the organizational knowledge base, they typically update the organizational process asset (OPA) known as "Lessons learned." Lessons learned are documented insights, knowledge, and best practices that are gained throughout the project's lifecycle. Updating this OPA helps capture valuable experiences and knowledge that can be applied to future projects to improve their performance and avoid repeating mistakes or challenges encountered in the current project.

questions.question_text: A project team is closing out a phase and updating the organizational knowledge base. What organizational process asset (OPA) will the team update?
What does the creation of a project management plan accomplish?

choices.A: Defines the basis of all project work and how it will be performed
choices.B: Acknowledges the existence of a project, and defines its high-level information
choices.D: Provides the project manager with organizational standards, policies, processes, and procedures
choices.C: Authorizes the project manager to apply organizational resources to project activities

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Defines the basis of all project work and how it will be performed
The project management plan is essentially the blueprint for the entire project. It outlines:   

Project objectives and deliverables
Work breakdown structure
Resource allocation
Schedule
Budget
Risk management strategies
Communication plan
Quality management plan

A. Defines the basis of all project work and how it will be performed

The creation of a project management plan accomplishes the definition of the basis of all project work and how it will be performed. The project management plan is a comprehensive document that outlines how the project will be executed, monitored, and controlled. It provides a detailed framework for managing all aspects of the project, including scope, schedule, cost, quality, risk, resources, communications, and more. Essentially, it serves as the roadmap for the project, detailing the approach, processes, and procedures that will guide the project from initiation to closure.

Selected Answer: C
C. Project charter
The project charter is the correct answer. It typically outlines the project's objectives, scope, high-level requirements, and initial project stakeholders. This information is crucial for identifying key stakeholders and determining their communication needs.

C. Project charter

When planning communications management, the input that identifies key stakeholders is the "Project charter." The project charter typically includes information about the project's objectives, purpose, high-level requirements, and key stakeholders. It often contains a list of project stakeholders or references the stakeholder register, which identifies individuals or groups who have an interest in or can influence the project. This information is essential for planning how communication will be managed with these key stakeholders throughout the project.
